quiz.question: When was Chandrayaan-3 launched?
quiz.explanation: Chandrayaan-3 was launched on July 14, 2023, at 14:35 IST from the Satish Dhawan Space Centre in Sriharikota, India.

quiz.question: What is the purpose of the Laser Retroreflector Array (LRA) instrument on the Chandrayaan-3 lander?
options: To act as a location marker
To measure altitude in three directions
quiz.answer: To act as a location marker
quiz.explanation: The LRA instrument on the Chandrayaan-3 lander acts as a location marker close to the lunar south pole, enabling orbiting spacecraft to use lasers for ranging.

quiz.question: What is the main reason for the landing failure of Chandrayaan-2 according to the article?
options: Altitude increase during the camera coasting phase
quiz.answer: Altitude increase during the camera coasting phase
quiz.explanation: One of the main reasons for Chandrayaan-2's landing failure was altitude increase during the camera coasting phase, which was addressed in Chandrayaan-3 by allowing the lander to control altitude and thrust during all descent phases.

quiz.question: What is the mass of the Pragyan rover on Chandrayaan-3?
quiz.explanation: The Pragyan rover on Chandrayaan-3 has a mass of 26 kilograms.

quiz.question: What was the impact point of the Cryogenic Upper Stage (C25) of the rocket used to launch Chandrayaan-3?
quiz.explanation: The Cryogenic Upper Stage (C25) of the rocket used for Chandrayaan-3 made an uncontrolled re-entry into the Earth's atmosphere with the impact point predicted over the North Pacific Ocean.
